verses.name: Proverbs 17:1
verses.text: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:2
verses.text: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:3
verses.text: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the Lord trieth the hearts.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:4
verses.text: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:5
verses.text: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.
